value.title: Some tips for your data labels in Power BI
value.excerpt: Charts can be hard to understand sometimes. Ambiguity is never a good thing. value.title: Source Control with Power BI - Can it be done?
value.excerpt: Can we use source control, or version control, with Power BI? We get this question ALL THE TIME! Adam walks you through what your options are and how this works today with Power BI.  ALM Toolkit: http://alm-toolkit.com/  Tabular Editor: https://tabulareditor.com/  Latest updates for Deployment Pipelines:

value.title: SQL Server in Microsoft Fabric? Use CETaS to move data!
value.excerpt: People have been asking "What about SQL Server?" with regards to Microsoft Fabric. Bob Ward joins us to show a way you can get your SQL data into Fabric with CETaS and the power of shortcuts in OneLake. And, then use that data in Power BI!  CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE AS SELECT (CETAS) (Transact-SQL) https://learn.microsoft.com/sql/t-sql/statements/create-external-table-as-select-transact-sql?view=sql-server-ver16&tabs=powershell

value.title: To Pivot or Unpivot? That is the question!
value.excerpt: Sometimes your data isn't shaped the right way. Have you tried the Pivot or Unpivot methods in Power Query? They can help get your data looking the right way for your Power BI reports!  Pivot columns https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-query/pivot-columns  Unpivot columns https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-query/unpivot-column

value.title: Using Images from a Database in Power BI
value.excerpt: We've looked at images from sources like OneDrive and the web with your Power BI reports. What about from a database? Is that possible? Patrick takes a look at how you can do it.  SQLJason Blog:  http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  Gerhard's Blog: https://blog.gbrueckl.at/2018/01/storing-images-powerbi-analysis-services-data-models/

value.title: Using R Visuals with Power BI
value.excerpt: You can take advantage of the R Script showcase to start using R Visuals with your reports. These provide great examples of what your R Script should look like to interact with data and you can compare how your visual looks to the example.   R Script Showcase - http://community.powerbi.com/t5/R-Script-Showcase/bd-p/RVisuals

value.title: Wait! We can use Databricks data with Microsoft Fabric???
value.excerpt: Ready to learn how you can use Databricks with Microsoft Fabric? Patrick shows you how you can integrate the data and enable the MAGIC of Fabric while leveraging your existing Databricks implementation.   Using Azure Databricks with Microsoft Fabric and OneLake https://blog.fabric.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/using-azure-databricks-with-microsoft-fabric-and-onelake

value.title: What are Power BI data connectors and why should you care?
value.excerpt: You need a connector to work with data in Power Query for Power BI or Excel. But what is a connector? Adam explains what these are and how to find out what's available.  Power Query Connectors: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-query/connectors/  Power BI data sources: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/connect-data/power-bi-data-sources

value.title: Why can't I use Microsoft Fabric?
value.excerpt: You've heard about all the great things with Microsoft Fabric, but you don't see it in the portal. You only see the Power BI items and no persona switcher. What's going on? Adam shows you to enable Fabric for your tenant.  Enable Microsoft Fabric for your organization https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/admin/fabric-switch

value.title: Generate Year Month Day Combinations in Power BI Report using Power Query Date ToText Function

value.title: Power BI Incremental Refresh and Hybrid Tables
value.excerpt: The default configuration for the Power BI dataset is to wipe out the entire data and reload it again. This can be a long process if you have a big dataset. Hybrid tables in Power BI keep part of the data in DirectQuery, and the rest is imported for data freshness and performance. In this video, I explain

value.title: Computing rolling average in DAX
value.excerpt: Computing the rolling 12-months average in DAX looks simple, but it hides some level of complexity.  This article explains how to write the best formula and how to avoid common pitfalls using time intelligence functions. Article and download: https://sql.bi/15161?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
